guide.introduction: Learn to Solder Surface Mount Devices (SMD or SMT) by hand using a good quality Soldering Iron and some very common tools.
guide.introduction_rendered: Learn to Solder Surface Mount Devices (SMD or SMT) by hand using a good quality Soldering Iron and some very common tools.

lines.text: Bottom Side of the PCB has White Solder Mask.
lines.text_raw: Bottom Side of the PCB has White Solder Mask.

lines.text: A finished Board with all the Surface Mount Devices Soldered with the DC Jack, Reset Button, and an On/Off Switch.
lines.text_raw: A finished Board with all the Surface Mount Devices Soldered with the DC Jack, Reset Button, and an On/Off Switch.

lines.text: Prepare the Soldering Iron and the Tools that you require.
lines.text_raw: Prepare the Soldering Iron and the Tools that you require.

lines.text: Get all the necessary Components at one place (preferable in a box). Or, you may have some neat bins.
lines.text_raw: Get all the necessary Components at one place (preferable in a box). Or, you may have some neat bins.

lines.text: We will start with our Input Voltage Source. You will get an idea of the Power Path by looking at the Schematic
lines.text_raw: We will start with our Input Voltage Source. You will get an idea of the Power Path by looking at the Schematic

lines.text: First up, is the DC Jack. then the Diode, then the Switch.
lines.text_raw: First up, is the DC Jack. then the Diode, then the Switch.

lines.text: Then will come the Voltage Regulator.
lines.text_raw: Then will come the Voltage Regulator.

guide.summary: ArduBoard is an Arduino Compatible Board designed by keeping in mind easy interfacing of I2C devices, on-board 5V, 3.3V Voltage Regulators and FTDI compatibility in a compact form-factor which is also BreadBoard Compatible!
guide.title: ArduBoard - Learn to Solder Surface Mount Devices (SMD)
